(* ### Problem

fixes binom :: "(nat \<times> nat) \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "binom (15, 8) = 6435"
and h1 : "binom (16, 9) = 11440"
and h2 : "binom (16, 10) = 8008"
and h3 : "\<forall> n k. n \<ge> k \<longrightarrow> binom (n, k) = binom (n - 1, k - 1) + binom (n - 1, k)"
shows  "binom (15, 10) = 3003"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: In combinatorics, the binomial coefficient of (n, k) can be calculated using the following recursive formula: for n ≥ k, binom(n, k) = binom(n-1, k-1) + binom(n-1, k). Given that binom(15, 8) = 6435, binom(16, 9) = 11440, and binom(16, 10) = 8008, find the value of binom(15, 10). The final answer is 3003.
